title: Encounters with whales
creator_contributor_role: Victorian Council for Children's Films and Television, distributor
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural history
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Television
description: Tina Dalton dedicates this film "to the gentle leviathans of the sea, whose beauty and innocence have awakened me." Aboard the Tall Ship "Anna Kristina", a team of scientists and Tina observe and interact with Humpback Whales of Platypus Bay. This video captures rare images of these giants, leaping out of the water in a spectacular display of strength and grace, interacting with Tina in a special show of trust and males fighting for mating supremacy. Share the joy with a team of rescuers as they save a stranded whale.
